definition: stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill

sentences.english: Hence its mixed results and recent stagnation.
sentences.chinese: 因此它混淆了結果和最近的停滯。

sentences.english: But the time of suspense is dreadful.
sentences.chinese: 但停滯的那段時間是可怕的。

sentences.english: It's the harsh truth where Cancún communiques fall silent.
sentences.chinese: 殘酷的事實是坎昆公報停滯了這件事。

sentences.english: I plan to be very "visible" during and post stasis.
sentences.chinese: 我計劃在停滯期期間和之後非常“易見”。

sentences.english: Young women’s employment has stagnated and is well below that of young men.
sentences.chinese: 女青年的就業率停滯了，而且大大低於男青年。

sentences.english: But the talks have been stalemated for years.
sentences.chinese: 但是談判停滯了好多年。

sentences.english: Stagnation and fatigue are other factors that can negatively affect concentration.
sentences.chinese: 停滯和疲憊是影響你專注力的另外的因素。

sentences.english: The stagnant global economy will dent China's export growth for years to come.
sentences.chinese: 停滯不前的全球經濟將削弱中國未來幾年的出口增長。

sentences.english: Because commercial pattern is pendent , all jobs backwater not before.
sentences.chinese: 由於商業模式懸而未決，所有的工作都停滯不前。

sentences.english: But Spence said that's not enough to lift the global economy out of the doldrums.
sentences.chinese: 但斯彭斯表示，這些並不足以提振停滯的全球經濟。

sentences.english: Heavy snowfalls brought traffic to a halt.
sentences.chinese: 大雪使得交通陷入停滯。

sentences.english: But the slow developmentof Namyang and the restrictive trade policies of the DPRK have brought businessto a standstill.
sentences.chinese: 南陽緩慢的發展和朝鮮嚴格的貿易限制使生意停滯。

sentences.english: And a developing country may become stalled at the brain drain stage.
sentences.chinese: 在人才外流階段發展中國家的發展可能會陷入停滯。

sentences.english: Once we were standing still in time, chasing the fantasies that filled our minds.
sentences.chinese: 我們曾經停滯在時間裏，追尋着盈溢心中的幻想。

sentences.english: By and by, all came to halt, the autumn in chilly night in frame frozen.
sentences.chinese: 時光停滯，漸漸地，定格在這寒夜秋塘落葉。

sentences.english: That could mean the export recovery slows or stagnates.
sentences.chinese: 這可能意味着出口復甦放緩甚至停滯。

definition: to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
to cut short/to break off/to discontinue/to interrupt
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
